alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Le Flore; Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 11:52PM CDT until June 18 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Pushmataha County in southeastern Oklahoma... Eastern Choctaw County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southwestern Le Flore County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 1215 AM CDT. * At 1152 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles west of Yanush to 3 miles west of Cloudy to 5 miles south of Sawyer, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations in or near the path include... Fort Towson... Sawyer... Albion... Hugo Lake State Park... Raymond Gary State Park... Nashoba... Kiamichi... Oleta... Cloudy... Corinne... Fallon... Sobol... Swink... Frogville... Huskey... Honobia... THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
